data_bindings.name: Name
data_bindings.description: The name that appears in popups and panels.

data_bindings.name: Label
data_bindings.description: The name that's used for region labels on the map.

data_bindings.name: Group (experimental)
data_bindings.description: Draw borders around groups of regions, e.g. state borders around counties. May produce odd results if the points of regions with shared boundaries do not match precisely.

data_bindings.name: Series
data_bindings.description: Values in the selected column can be used to define specific color and line styles in the settings panel.

settings.name: Minimum area
settings.description: In km². Polygons representing areas below this size won't be considered when fitting the map. Setting is ignored if no polygons are bigger than the specified minimum area.

settings.name: Include lines data
settings.description: Include lines when calculating the bounds of the map

settings.name: Padding (%)
settings.description: Padding added to map (as percentage of smaller of width and height)

settings.name: Zoom
settings.description: 1 to show whole world, > 1 to zoom in.

settings.name: Aspect ratio
settings.description: Width divided by height. If left blank will use aspect ratio of projection for whole world.

settings.name: Fill
settings.description: Ignored for regions with values.

settings.name: Extend
settings.description: Automatically generate additional colours when needed to avoid the palette colours being used more than once.

settings.name: Custom overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the entity whose colour you want to set, a colon and then a colour (using a name, hex-code or rgb declaration). Multiple colours can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Party 1: red
Party 2: #4455AA
Party 3: rgb(30,168,26)
In linear mode, the color scale will run as a smooth gradient between 2 colors. In binned mode, the gradient will be divided in smaller blocks.

settings.name: Custom thresholds
settings.description: Write your custom thresholds, separated by a ";" For example 5;10;15

settings.name: Base default scale on:
settings.description: Determines whether or not to update the default colour scale when switching between Value columns. Note that any non-default scale settings (such as custom bin thresholds) will always apply across all columns.

settings.name: Opacity
settings.description: This value is multiplied by the Fill opacity value.

settings.name: Prefix
settings.description: Text to place in front of number

settings.name: Suffix
settings.description: Text to place after number

settings.name: Decimal places
settings.description: Use negative integers to round to positive powers of ten (eg -2 rounds to the nearest 100)

settings.name: Hide thousands separator below 10,000
settings.description: Turn off if you want four-digit numbers to include a separator, e.g. “1,234” rather than “1234”.

settings.name: Outline color
settings.description: The color of the label outline.

settings.name: Font size
settings.description: Label size (as a percentage of the base font size)

settings.name: Outline width (%)
settings.description: Width of label outline (as a percentage of font size).

settings.name: Label priority
settings.description:
Specify the prority with which labels should be drawn. For example:
Italy
Germany
Puerto Rico

settings.name: Hide labels
settings.description:
Specify labels which should be hidden. For example:
France
Spain
United Kingdom

settings.name: Only show labels on 'Label priority' list
settings.description: If true, only the labels on the priority list will be drawn.

settings.name: Spacing (%)
settings.description: Specify the space to leave around each label as a percentage of font size. Increase this setting to reduce label overcrowding.

settings.name: Minimum radius
settings.description: Any smaller circles will be scaled up to the specified level. (Ignored if greater than the “Maximum radius” setting.)

settings.name: Maximum value
settings.description: Values bigger than this maximum will have a radius equal to the maximum radius. Leave blank to use the maximum in the dataset

settings.name: Base default scale on:
settings.description: Determines whether or not to update the default size scale when switching between Value columns.

settings.name: Extend
settings.description: Automatically generate additional colours when needed to avoid the palette colours being used more than once.

settings.name: Custom overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the entity whose colour you want to set, a colon and then a colour (using a name, hex-code or rgb declaration). Multiple colours can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Party 1: red
Party 2: #4455AA
Party 3: rgb(30,168,26)
In linear mode, the color scale will run as a smooth gradient between 2 colors. In binned mode, the gradient will be divided in smaller blocks.

settings.name: Custom thresholds
settings.description: Write your custom thresholds, separated by a ";" For example 5;10;15

settings.name: Place smaller points above
settings.description: If checked the smallest points are drawn last so they're always visible and hoverable. If not checked then points at the top of the data sheet are drawn first

settings.name: Prefix
settings.description: Text to place in front of number

settings.name: Suffix
settings.description: Text to place after number

settings.name: Decimal places
settings.description: Use negative integers to round to positive powers of ten (eg -2 rounds to the nearest 100)

settings.name: Hide thousands separator below 10,000
settings.description: Turn off if you want four-digit numbers to include a separator, e.g. “1,234” rather than “1234”.

settings.name: Overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the series whose colour you want to set, a colon and then a color (using a name, hex-code or rgb declaration). Multiple colors can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Rivers: blue
Borders: #444444

settings.name: Overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the series whose width you want to set, a colon and then a number between 0 and 5. Multiple widths can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Rivers: 0.5
Borders: 2

settings.name: Overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the series whose opacity you want to set, a colon and then a number between 0 and 1. Multiple opacities can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Rivers: 0.5
Borders: 1

settings.name: Overrides
settings.description:
Type the name of the series whose line-dash style you want to set, a colon and then a line-dash style (“solid”, “long”, “short“ or “mixed”). Multiple line-dash styles can be set using multiple lines. For example:
Rivers: solid
Borders: long

settings.name: Boundary precision
settings.description: Larger values will give smoother boundaries but may highlight small topological errors

settings.name: Control type
settings.description: Choose between a dropdown, buttons or a time slider.

settings.name: Time between steps
settings.description: Measured in seconds, positive values move the slider left to right, negative values move the slider right to left.

settings.name: Pause before loop
settings.description: Measured in seconds and in addition to the regular step time displayed above.

settings.name: Date/time format in data
settings.description: The date/time format in your data sheet. Used only to sort the data, if required. If your format isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Control type
settings.description: Choose between a dropdown, buttons or a time slider.

settings.name: Time between steps
settings.description: Measured in seconds, positive values move the slider left to right, negative values move the slider right to left.

settings.name: Pause before loop
settings.description: Measured in seconds and in addition to the regular step time displayed above.

settings.name: Date/time format in data
settings.description: The date/time format in your data sheet. Used only to sort the data, if required. If your format isn’t in the list, you can enter a custom format using d3-time-format syntax. See npmjs.com/package/d3-time-format for details.

settings.name: Height
settings.description: Space below and above controls text

settings.name: Border style
settings.description: Show border on all sides, or only at the bottom

settings.name: Popup custom header
settings.description:
The text to appear in the popup. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.
You can also hide content based on a column name being empty using  {{# if column_name}}Text to display when column_name is not empty{{/if}}. For example: {{Country}} {{#if Capital}}(Capital: {{Capital}}){{/if}}

settings.name: Popup custom main content
settings.description:
The text to appear in the popup. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.
You can also hide content based on a column name being empty using  {{# if column_name}}Text to display when column_name is not empty{{/if}}. For example: {{Country}} {{#if Capital}}(Capital: {{Capital}}){{/if}}

settings.name: Max width
settings.description: In rems, multiples of base font size. Leave blank to let the width adjust based on the contents.

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: Corner radius of popup

settings.name: Panel custom header
settings.description:
The text to appear in the panel. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.
You can also hide content based on a column name being empty using  {{# if column_name}}Text to display when column_name is not empty{{/if}}. For example: {{Country}} {{#if Capital}}(Capital: {{Capital}}){{/if}}

settings.name: Panel custom main content
settings.description:
The text to appear in the panel. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.
You can also hide content based on a column name being empty using  {{# if column_name}}Text to display when column_name is not empty{{/if}}. For example: {{Country}} {{#if Capital}}(Capital: {{Capital}}){{/if}}

settings.name: Vertical position
settings.description: Choosing "Click position" is especially useful when your visualisation is really tall, this will make sure the panel content is always on top of the element you've clicked on

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: Corner radius of panel

settings.name: Popup custom header
settings.description:
The text to appear in the popup. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.
You can also hide content based on a column name being empty using  {{# if column_name}}Text to display when column_name is not empty{{/if}}. For example: {{Country}} {{#if Capital}}(Capital: {{Capital}}){{/if}}

settings.name: Popup custom main content
settings.description:
The text to appear in the popup. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.

You can also use {{VALUE}} to get the currently displayed value, and {{METRIC}} to get the associated column header – useful when multiple value columns are set.

settings.name: Max width
settings.description: In rems, multiples of base font size. Leave blank to let the width adjust based on the contents.

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: Corner radius of popup

settings.name: Panel custom header
settings.description:
The text to appear in the panel. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.
You can also hide content based on a column name being empty using  {{# if column_name}}Text to display when column_name is not empty{{/if}}. For example: {{Country}} {{#if Capital}}(Capital: {{Capital}}){{/if}}

settings.name: Panel custom main content
settings.description:
The text to appear in the popup. You can use {{column_name}} to add a value from your data. It must be in a selected column, but you can add columns to “Metadata” if you just want to include them for use in the popup. Advanced users can include HTML to apply layouts, formatting, images, etc.

You can also use {{VALUE}} to get the currently displayed value, and {{METRIC}} to get the associated column header – useful when multiple value columns are set.

settings.name: Vertical position
settings.description: Choosing "Click position" is especially useful when your visualisation is really tall, this will make sure the panel content is always on top of the element you've clicked on

settings.name: Radius
settings.description: Corner radius of panel

settings.name: Bar width
settings.description: Width of the search bar when expanded

settings.name: Stroke
settings.description: Strongness of stroke color

settings.name: Placeholder text
settings.description: The text to show when the search field is empty

settings.name: Always show dropdown suggestions
settings.description: If disabled it will only show suggestions after typing 2 characters

settings.name: Show point color legend
settings.description: Legend will always be hidden if there are over 100 categories

settings.name: Roundness
settings.description: The radius of the corners of the swatch (in pixels)

settings.name: Padding
settings.description: Padding between legend items (in rems)

settings.name: Custom order override
settings.description: Manually specify the order of legend entries (one entry per line)

settings.name: Height
settings.description: Height of icon (relative to the base font size)

settings.name: Color
settings.description: Fallback color (icon color if not determined by template)

settings.name: Stroke
settings.description: Hint: set to same value as fill for no stroke

settings.name: Max height
settings.description: Maximum height of shape (relative to root font size)

settings.name: Small circle
settings.description: Proportion of the small circle compared to the big circle. 0.5 means it's half the value of the big circle.

settings.name: Show region color legend
settings.description: Categorical legend will always be hidden if there are over 100 categories

settings.name: Roundness
settings.description: The radius of the corners of the swatch (in pixels)

settings.name: Padding
settings.description: Padding between legend items (in rems)

settings.name: Custom order override
settings.description: Manually specify the order of legend entries (one entry per line)

settings.name: Height
settings.description: Height of icon (relative to the base font size)

settings.name: Color
settings.description: Fallback color (icon color if not determined by template)

settings.name: Roundness
settings.description: The radius of the corners of the color band (in pixels)

settings.name: Custom bin labels
settings.description: List numeric values, separated by semi-colons.

settings.name: Animation duration (in seconds)
settings.description: Used when changing slides in stories

settings.name: Zoom message (key)
settings.description: {{KEY}} is a special name that will be replaced by 'Ctrl' on Windows and '⌘' on Apple computers

settings.name: Decimal separator in data sheet
settings.description: Used for interpreting your data. Only change if data is not displaying on the chart as expected.

settings.name: Number format to display
settings.description: How the numbers should appear on chart labels

settings.name: Main font
settings.description: This font will apply to the whole graphic by default, but you can optionally change the font for the title, subtitle, footer, etc in the Header and Footer settings panels.

settings.name: Text color
settings.description: This color will apply to the whole graphic by default, but you can optionally change the color for individual text elements, in other settings panels.

settings.name: Maximum width
settings.description: Apply a maximum width to just the main graphic or everything (main graphic plus header, footer, etc)

settings.name: Maximum width
settings.description: Leave blank to stretch to container width

settings.name: Custom
settings.description: Specify a custom responsive font size. Best results will be with values between 1.2 and 3

settings.name: Custom
settings.description: Specify a custom responsive font size. Best results will be with values between 1.2 and 3

settings.name: Custom
settings.description: Specify a custom responsive font size. Best results will be with values between 1.2 and 3

settings.name: Space
settings.description: Space between border and header text

settings.name: Align
settings.description: Align logo inside header or outer visualisation container
The secondary note is placed below the source and primary note
settings.name: Note (secondary)

defaults.datastudio: Visit flourish.studio to create branded, embeddable, mobile-friendly visualizations

settings.name: Image (light version)
settings.description: If provided this version will be used whenever the background colour is dark

settings.name: Space
settings.description: Space between border and footer text

settings.name: Screenreader mode for main visual container
settings.description: Whether the main visual container is visible to screenreaders. (Text in the header and footer are always available to screenreaders.)

settings.name: Screenreader description
settings.description: A text alternative to the visual content that will only be visible to screenreaders, e.g. “The line chart shows China consistently higher than the other countries since 1990”. Do no replicate your title, since that will also be read by screenreaders.

settings.name: Selected feature
settings.description: Region or point which is highlighted and which the popup should point to. If nothing is highlighted then this should be null. Otherwise it should be a string of the form <type>-<index>, where <type> is either "regions" or "points" and index is the corresponding (0-based) row index. For example "regions-0" or "points-134". When this value is not null, the sticky_hover property should usually be true.

settings.name: Is the popup and highlighting fixed to the hovered_feature (true) or should moving the mouse over other features change which feature is highlighted?
Points filter
settings.description: An object whose keys are names of the colour categories (for points) that should be filtered out and whose values are (usually) something truthy.

settings.name: Zoom transformation
settings.description: An object specifying the transformation to zoom the map in on a region. It has five properties. k is the zoom level (k = 1 for no zoom, k > 1 for zoomed in). x and y are the negatives of the horizontal and vertical coordinates (0, 0 is the top left corner) the zoom is centred on. width and height specify the width and height (in pixels) of the map on which the transform is performed.
